LCOV - code coverage report
Current view: top level - home/yyan7/compiler/rexompiler/src/frontend/SageIII/astTokenStream - tokenStreamMapping.C (source / functions) Hit Total Coverage
Test: ROSE Lines: 0 1410 0.0 %
Date: 2022-12-08 13:48:47 Functions: 0 33 0.0 %
Legend: Lines: hit not hit 

          Line data    Source code
       1             : /*
       2             : // This file supports the new parse tree support in ROSE.
       3             : // specifically this is a "Concrete Syntax Augmented AST"
       4             : // Because the ROSE IR is close to that of the C/C++/Fortran 
       5             : // grammar the parse tree can be derived from the token stream
       6             : // and the AST.  The principal representation of the CSA AST
       7             : // is a map using the IR nodes of the AST as keys into the map
       8             : // and the map elements being a data structure (TokenStreamSequenceToNodeMapping)
       9             : // containing three pairs of indexes representing the subsequence 
      10             : // of tokens for the leading tokens (often white space), the token
      11             : // subsequence for the AST IR node (including its subtree), and
      12             : // the trailing token subsequence (often white space).
      13             : 
      14             : // So where the AST might be:
      15             : //        SgWhileStmt
      16             : //        /        \
      17             : // SgStatement  SgStatement
      18             : // (predicate)    (body)
      19             : //
      20             : // The associated parse tree would be:
      21             : //
      22             : //              SgWhileStmt
      23             : //        /  /      \      \      \
      24             : // "while" "(" SgStatement  ")" SgStatement
      25             : //               (predicate)      (body)
      26             : //
      27             : // (so much for ASCI art).
      28             : //
      29             : 
      30             : // We have a number of ways that we expect could be a problem for this 
      31             : // token stream mapping (possible failure modes):
      32             : //   1) Toky() macro to write code (not working yet)
      33             : //   2) Token pasting operator ## (WORKS)
      34             : //   3) Use equivalent of generated binary as a test for generate source code 
      35             : //      that is equivalent to the input file up to the use of new lines and other 
      36             : //      white space (THIS IS NOT A GREAT TEST (unless the filename of the generated 
      37             : //      code is made the same)).
      38             : //   4) Use multiple variable names in the same variable declaration (FIXED).
      39             : //
      40             : // Each of these are being addressed before moving this code into ROSE,
      41             : // merging it with the Wave support, and modifying the unparser to 
      42             : // use the token stream support.
      43             : */
      44             : 
      45             : // DQ (10/5/2014): This is more strict now that we include rose_config.h in the sage3basic.h.
      46             : // #include "rose.h"
      47             : #include "sage3basic.h"
      48             : 
      49             : #include "FileUtility.h"
      50             : #include "general_token_defs.h"
      51             : 
      52             : 
      53             : // This does not appear to exist for my version of boost.
      54             : // #include <boost/icl/interval_map.hpp>
      55             : 
      56             : 
      57             : // DQ (10/9/2013): Required mods:
      58             : //    1) The edges of subtress need to be trimmed back to avoid overlap.
      59             : //       Also all overlap should be detected.
      60             : //    2) The sharing should cause multiple IR nodes to be associated with 
      61             : //       a token susbsequence data structure.
      62             :
